channel.title: East Village on Table41NYC
channel.description: Recent content in East Village on Table41NYC

item.title: Ikinari
item.description: Got the rare strip. It was pretty good for $30 for 14 oz. Not a lot of fat on it. I think the price keeps getting cheaper because not a lot of people go to this.

item.title: Zadie's Oyster Room
item.description: Different cooking styles for all types of oysters. Was pretty good.

item.title: Momofuku Noodle Bar
item.description: Super salty and overrated. The only good Momofoku restaurants is Fuku (the fried chicken joint) and Ko (the michelin star).

item.title: Ippudo
item.description: Overrated and pricey. I’d skip here any day of the week. Daikokuya in LA is way better.

item.title: Zundo Ya
item.description: It’s just ok.

item.title: Ramen Misoya
item.description: Recommended by Totto Ramen server for best thick noodle in NYC. Soup was bad and salty. But yeah the noodle was pretty good.

item.title: Martina Pizzeria
item.description: Fast food version of Marta’s. It’s good. I like the salami and hot peppers, and it’s fairly inexpensive.

item.title: Hearth
item.description: Was good but nothing particularly struck a note to me. Marc Forgione tasting menu is way better than here.

item.title: Senor Pollo
item.description: This place is pretty cheap. I remember both the lomo and pollo being a bit on the dry side, but it’s so cheap not much of a reason to complain I guess.

item.title: Shabu Tatsu
item.description: Fairly inexpensive, but not very OG. Portions are small, and no where as good as LA shabu shabu.

item.title: Robataya Ny
item.description: This place was such a gimmick. Very showy like Benihanas but way worse. Food was just ok and super pricey. They have bday celebrations… super weird. But it’s CLOSED.

item.title: Curry Ya
item.description: The spicy pork tonkatsu was pretty good. One of the better Japanese curry places in the city.

item.title: Fuku
item.description: A few doors down from the Ssam bar, this place is pretty good. $12 for a combo which was basically drink, fries, and the sandwich. The Momofuku red sauce is always good. Unfortunately this is CLOSED.

item.title: Raclette
item.description: They are super stingy with the cheese, and it stinks the instant you walk in. But otherwise, it’s delicious. You are allotted 2 cheese shavings. One of the guests at my table did not want their second shaving, so I used their second shaving for a total of three shaving. It’s good but not too expensive.

item.title: Spot Dessert Bar
item.description: Pretty good. Some interesting stuff, but maybe somewhat gimmicky?

item.title: Chikalicious
item.description: This stuff is pretty good especially the panna cotta.

item.title: Hot Box
item.description: Decent personalized hotpot place. Similar to Boiling Point.

item.title: Ho Foods
item.description: Taiwanese beef noodle was pretty good. $$$ but the broth was good. Long wait, but not sure if it’s worth it. I kinda want to make my own again.

item.title: Just for Fen
item.description: Was decent albeit expensive. Didn’t care for the noodles at all.

item.title: 99 Favor Taste
item.description: This place is ok for hotpot and bbq. About $33 for AYCE both.

item.title: Yuan
item.description: Noodles pretty good, but service sucks big time. It’s probably why this place is PERMA CLOSED.

item.title: Dumpling Man
item.description: XLB was just ok. Price was cheap.

item.title: Mimi Cheng's Dumplings
item.description: Expensive for what it is.

item.title: 5 Napkin Burger
item.description: Overrated. I don’t get why people think this is good. Rather go to Shake Shack or something else.

item.title: The Spotted Owl Tavern
item.description: Ok spot.
